member.name: F:FOSS.Nova.Common.CommunicationObjectWrapper`1.completionReported

member.name: M:FOSS.Nova.Common.DataAccess.AuditTrailHelper.GetAuditTrail(Foss.Mosaic.Foundation.CoreDomain.Instrument,Foss.Foundation.Common.SimpleContract.Product,System.Int32,System.Security.Cryptography.RSACryptoServiceProvider,System.String)
member.summary: Returns audit trail object (with correct ID) for given instrument and product.
member.param: Instrument to get audit trail for.
Product to get audit trail for.
Crypto service provider which is used for creating signature
Serial number to use incase of multiple instruments
member.returns: Already existing audit trail, if timestamp of it is not older than of instrument and product. Creates and returns new audit trail if timestamp of existing one is older than of instrument and/or product. Creates and returns new audit trail if there is no existing one for given instrument and product.
member.remarks: Product and sample type are not needed when audit trail for self test is requested.

member.summary: Last upload session day (of the year). Used to create new upload session each day. When new network configuration system is added, this property is null, until first upload update session is created. Updated when new upload update session is created.

member.name: P:FOSS.Nova.Common.DataAccess.ConfigurationSystem.LastDownloadSessionID
member.summary: Last download session ID. Used to verify that session is still available before activation. When new network configuration system is added, this property is null, until first download update session is found on Mosaic server. Updated when new download update session is found.

member.name: T:FOSS.Nova.Common.DataAccess.IDatabaseSnapshot
member.summary: Database snapshots are used in order to simplify access to the data which are frequently accessed but rarely modified. These data include: configuration systems, instrument with extensions and settings, products, operation profiles, prediction models with settings, standardization groups, licenses and etc. This interface describes the accessors to the data.

member.name: P:FOSS.Nova.Common.DataAccess.SettingsAccessors.InstrumentSettings.AutoSampleNumberingSettingGroup.AutoNumberingFormat
member.summary: Supported advanced Sample Number formatting codes (must be upper case): [INSTRUMENTNAME] - Name of instrument [PRODUCTNAME] - Name of current Product [PRODUCTCODE] - Code of current Product [HH] - Hours (24) [HHHH] - Hours (12 + AM/PM) [MM] - Minutes [SS] - Seconds [DD] - Day [M] - Month [Y] - Year (3) [YY] - Year (13) [YYYY] - Year (2013) #-####### - Sequential Product specific sample counter. Prefixes with 0's and wraps according to the number of digits. 'Sample-###' creates sample numbers from 'Sample-001' to 'Sample-999'. No more than 9 # characters are allowed in the format string.

member.summary: Used by .NET infrastricture for serialization in case is exception needs to cross AppDomain boundary. This exception is not truly serializable and do not expected to flow between domains, but we don't wont system to crash with meaningless exception if for some reason it'll have to flow to another domain.

member.name: T:FOSS.Nova.Common.Encryption.CryptoVersion
member.summary: Version of algorithm-key combinations.
member.remarks: This is the current version number for each kind of encryption that Nova performs. If the encryption algorithm or password is changed for any kind, or we start encrypting a different kind of data, USE A HIGHER UNUSED VERSION NUMBER FOR ANY CHANGES. This is critical since old data will be saved on Mosaic servers and instruments, and we must be able to decrypt any data ever generated by real instrument measurements. IF IN DOUBT, SWITCH TO A NEW UNUSED NUMBER. Attention: Don't forget to change Tools\Sources\TestHelpers\Resources\CryptoVersionTestData.xlsx if you change enum CryptoVersion

member.summary:
This method should not be used by the Quartz client.
Called when the has decided to 'fire' the trigger (Execute the associated ), in order to give the a chance to update itself for its next triggering (if any).

member.name: M:FOSS.Nova.Common.Scheduler.AdvancedScheduler.Trigger.ComputeFirstFireTimeUtc(FOSS.Nova.Common.Scheduler.AdvancedScheduler.Calendar)
member.summary: This method should not be used by the Quartz client.

remarks.p: Called by the scheduler at the time a is first added to the scheduler, in order to have the compute its first fire time, based on any associated calendar.
After this method has been called, should return a valid answer.

member.returns: The first time at which the will be fired by the scheduler, which is also the same value will return (until after the first firing of the ).

member.name: M:FOSS.Nova.Common.Scheduler.AdvancedScheduler.Trigger.GetMayFireAgain
member.summary: Used by the to determine whether or not it is possible for this to fire again.

member.name: M:FOSS.Nova.Common.Scheduler.AdvancedScheduler.Trigger.GetNextFireTimeUtc
member.summary: Returns the next time at which the is scheduled to fire. If the trigger will not fire again, will be returned. Note that the time returned can possibly be in the past, if the time that was computed for the trigger to next fire has already arrived, but the scheduler has not yet been able to fire the trigger (which would likely be due to lack of resources e.g. threads).

member.name: M:FOSS.Nova.Common.Scheduler.AdvancedScheduler.Trigger.GetPreviousFireTimeUtc
member.summary: Returns the previous time at which the fired. If the trigger has not yet fired, will be returned.

member.name: M:FOSS.Nova.Common.Scheduler.AdvancedScheduler.Trigger.GetScheduledFireTimeUtc
member.summary: Returns the scheduled time at which the trigger should have been triggered. Usually mean something if misfire was detected

member.name: P:FOSS.Nova.Common.Scheduler.AdvancedScheduler.Trigger.MisfireInstruction
member.summary: Get or set the instruction the should be given for handling misfire situations for this - the concrete type that you are using will have defined a set of additional MISFIRE_INSTRUCTION_XXX constants that may be passed to this method.

member.name: P:FOSS.Nova.Common.Scheduler.AdvancedScheduler.Trigger.EndTimeUtc
member.summary:
Returns the date/time on which the trigger must stop firing. This defines the final boundary for trigger firings 舒 the trigger will not fire after to this date and time. If this value is null, no end time boundary is assumed, and the trigger can continue indefinitely.
Sets the date/time on which the trigger must stop firing. This defines the final boundary for trigger firings 舒 the trigger will not fire after to this date and time. If this value is null, no end time boundary is assumed, and the trigger can continue indefinitely.

member.name: P:FOSS.Nova.Common.Scheduler.AdvancedScheduler.Trigger.StartTimeUtc
member.summary: The time at which the trigger's scheduling should start. May or may not be the first actual fire time of the trigger, depending upon the type of trigger and the settings of the other properties of the trigger. However the first actual first time will not be before this date.
member.remarks: Setting a value in the past may cause a new trigger to compute a first fire time that is in the past, which may cause an immediate misfire of the trigger.

member.summary: Set trigger to fire immediately and return to normal schedule
